newsitem.title: USA: Cox CFO sees meeting FY96 estimates.
newsitem.headline: Cox CFO sees meeting FY96 estimates.

text.p: Cox Communications Inc's Chief Financial Officer Jimmy Hayes said Tuesday that the company was on track to meet analysts' expectations for fiscal year 1996.
"We are very much on track with expectations," Hayes said.
According to First Call, the consensus estimates are for a loss of $0.06 per share for fiscal 1996.

Speaking at a PaineWebber media conference, Hayes also said he expected capital spending for 1997 to be in the range of $650 milion to $670 million. Hayes said the company's capital spending for 1996 was about $550 million.
Cox's strategy is to invest in a comprehensive upgrade of its cable network through 1997 so that the company can provide telephony and internet as well as broadcast services, he said.
The cable company said it was committed to the upgrade despite recent announcements that some of its competitors, namely Tele-Communications Inc, are cutting costs.
